title: EXO set for November comeback with sixth album
text:
EXO are set to make a comeback in November (Picture: Getty Images)

K-Pop icons EXO are set to make a comeback with their sixth album before the end of the year.

According to south Korean media, EXO’s agency SM Entertainment responded to reports the group will return in November.

SM said in a statement: ‘It’s true that EXO are preparing for their new full album. We will announce a specific release schedule soon.’

It will be their first album since the release of Don’t Mess Up My Tempo and the repackage album Love Shot last year.

While it’s not known for definite if singer Lay, who has been flying solo for the past few months, is taking part; the comeback will go ahead without members Xiumin and D.O. who both began their mandatory military service this year.

EXO-L, the name for EXO’s fans, celebrated the news with the hashtag #EXOISCOMING on social media.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Call Me Baby singers are currently on their EXO PLANET #5 – EXplOration tour.

It hasn’t been confirmed if Lay will be part of the comeback Getty Images)

The comeback takes place after the release of solo albums from members Baekhyun and Chen, and rappers Chanyeol and Sehun forming EXO-SC for their What A Life album in the summer.

Baekhyun has also recently been in the US promoting new boy group SuperM with fellow EXO star Kai.

The K-Pop group, made up of Xiumin, D.O., Baekhyun, Chen, Kai, Sehun, Chanyeol, Suho and Lay, may not be back together as a full group until 2025 given the different times members have to enlist.

description: K pop group EXO set for November comeback with sixth album say SM Entertainment
